books.title: The Great Gatsby
books.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
books.summary: The story primarily concerns the young and mysterious millionaire Jay Gatsby and his quixotic passion and obsession for the beautiful former debutante Daisy Buchanan.

books.title: To Kill a Mockingbird
books.author: Harper Lee
books.summary: The story, set in the Depression-era South, revolves around a young girl named Scout Finch. Her father, Atticus, a principled and dignified lawyer, defends a black man wrongfully accused of a grave crime.

books.author: George Orwell
books.summary: The story takes place in an imagined future, the year 1984, when much of the world has fallen victim to perpetual war, omnipresent government surveillance, historical negationism, and propaganda.

books.title: Pride and Prejudice
books.author: Jane Austen
books.summary: The novel follows the character development of Elizabeth Bennet, the dynamic protagonist, who learns about the repercussions of hasty judgments and comes to appreciate the difference between superficial goodness and actual goodness.

books.title: The Catcher in the Rye
books.author: J.D. Salinger
books.summary: The novel's protagonist Holden Caulfield has become an icon for teenage rebellion. The novel deals with complex issues of innocence, identity, belonging, loss, and connection.
